content.description:
Start on the right of the creekside face of the Smoke on the Water Boulder and traverse up and to the left. Top out at the apex. As with

Smoke on the Water Left

, much of this route will be over water in the spring, adding an interesting dynamic.
content.protection: Pad (summer); over ankle to knee deep water in spring.
content.location: This lies on the creek side of Smoke on the Water Boulder.

content.description: On the creekside of this boulder, start on the bottom left and work your way up to the apex and top out. This is a challenging and lengthy problem. In the spring, much of the route will be over water adding an interesting dynamic.
content.protection: Pad (summer); in spring the creek will be below you (ankle to knee deep).
content.location: This lies about a quarter mile upstream from Tiffany Boulder on the left side of the trail. You will have to cross the creek twice to get there.
